adjectives.description: beribboned (comparative more beribboned, superlative most beribboned)

examples: In a far cry from the late ’70s, when Tracy Austin’s pigtails and bangs signaled her youth and Chris Evert’s beribboned ponytail personified the country club ideal, today’s braids are creative and sophisticated.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of beribbon
